etymologies: late 17th century: from French rhumatisme, or via Latin from Greek rheumatismos, from rheumatizein ‘to snuffle’, from rheuma ‘stream’: the disease was originally supposed to be caused by the internal flow of ‘watery’ humors

definitions: any disease marked by inflammation and pain in the joints, muscles, or fibrous tissue, especially rheumatoid arthritis.
shortDefinitions: any disease marked by inflammation and pain in joints, muscles, or fibrous tissue
